reporting-org.narrative: Ministerstvo zahraničných vecí a európskych záležitostí SR
Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs of the Slovak Republic

title.narrative: Celoštátna bariéra proti šíreniu plagiátorstva na vysokých školách
National Barrier Against Spreading of Plagiarism at Universities

description.narrative:
Primárnym cieľom študijnej návštevy albánskej delegácie v Centre vedecko-technických informácií SR bolo oboznámenie sa so slovenskými skúsenosťami zo zavádzania a fungovania celoštátneho Antiplagiátorského systému (APS), a to z technickej ako aj administratívnej stránky.

V roku 2010 bol ANTIPLAG, ako sa subsystém pracovne volá, implementovaný ako súčasť projektu Centra vedecko-technických informácií SR (CVTI SR) pod záštitou Ministerstva školstva SR. Oficiálny názov tohto projektu je Systém na odhaľovanie plagiátov pre potreby slovenských akademických a výskumných inštitúcií a jeho fyzická realizácia vo forme portálu má názov Centrálny register záverečných a kvalifikačných prác (dostupný na www.crzp.sk). Jeho výstupom je protokol, ktorý upozorňuje na dokumenty, v ktorých bolo identifikované podozrenie na plagiátorstvo. Je nástrojom, ktorý upozorňuje na zhodné alebo identické dokumenty z internetu alebo práce z iných pracovísk, ktoré mohli uniknúť pozornosti školiteľa alebo oponenta pri posudzovaní záverečných prác. Slovensko je prvou krajinou na svete, ktorá má pokryté všetky univerzity rovnakým APS systémom. Od spustenia systému do konca marca 2018 bolo v systéme spolu 547 180 záverečných prác.

Zástupcovia Centra vedecko-technických informácií SR už ANTIPLAG a CRZP prezentovali kolegom z Moldavska, Gruzínska, Fínska a Poľska. Význam Antiplagiátorského systému (APS) ocenila aj Európska komisia v súťaži Európska cena za inováciu vo verejnej správe. APS tu získal najvyššie ocenenie v kategórii „Iniciatívy v oblasti vzdelávania a výskumu.“ Na Slovensku mu medzinárodná konferencia ITAPA udelila druhé miesto v kategórii „Nové služby“ (prvé miesto získal Centrálny register zmlúv, ktorý používame aj my).

The primary objective of the study visit for Albanian delegation at the Center for Scientific and Technical Information of the Slovak Republic was to familiarize with the Slovak experience of the implementation and operation of the National Anti-plagiarism System (APS), from both aspects: technical and administrative.

In 2010, ANTIPLAG was implemented as a part of the project of the Center for Scientific and Technical Information of the Slovak Republic (CVTI SR) under the auspices of the Ministry of Education of the SR. The official name of this project is a Plagiarism Detection System for the needs of Slovak academic and research institutions, and its physical implementation in the form of a portal is called the Central Register of Final and Qualification Works (available at www.crzp.sk). Its output is a protocol that draws attention to documents that have identified a plagiarism suspicion. It is a tool that draws attention to identical documents from the Internet or work from other workplaces that could escape the attention of the supervisor or the opponent in assessing the final work. Slovakia is the first country in the world that has all universities covered by the same APS system. Since the system was launched by the end of March 2018, there were 547 180 final work in the system.

Representatives of the Center for Scientific and Technical Information of the Slovak Republic had already presented ANTIPLAG and CRZP to colleagues from Moldova, Georgia, Finland and Poland. The importance of the Anti-plagiarism System (APS) was also appreciated by the European Commission in the European Prize for Innovation in Public Administration. APS has been awarded the highest award in the "Education and Research Initiative" category. In Slovakia ITAPA International Conference awarded it the second place in the "New Services" category (the first place of the Central Register of Treaties that we also use).

Ministerstvo školstva, športu a mládeže Albánskej republiky

description.narrative:
PROGRAM
Nationwide Barrier Against the Spread of Plagiarism at Higher Education Institutions

Delegation members:

1) Mr Bernard Dosti - Vice Rector, Tirana University, Republic of Albania
2) Ms Ejona Isufaj - Education Inspectorate,ISHA, Ministry of Education, Sport and Youth, Republic of Albania
3) Ms Denisa Shehaj - Education Inspectorate,ISHA, Ministry of Education, Sport and Youth, Republic of Albania
4) Mr Eni Kaci - National Library, Republic of Albania

Slovak Centre of Scientific and Technical Information (SCSTI) representatives:

1) Mr. Ján Turňa, General Director, Professor
2) Mr. Ľubomír Bilský, Director of Science Support Section
3) Mr. Juraj Noge, Head of the ISD Department
4) Mr. Július Kravjar, Responsible for CRTD and PDS , ISD Department
5) Mr. Marián Trgala, Head of Application System Dept., subdepartment of ISD Department
6) Ms. Danica Zendulková, Head of the CRIS Department
7) Ms. Marta Dušková, Head of the Department for Evaluation of Publication Activity
8) Ms. Barbora Pokojná, Department for Evaluation of Artistic Activity
9) Ms. Jana Bezáková, Department for Evaluation of Artistic Activity

Contact person present:

Ms. Veronika Basta, CETIR Point of Contact, mobile: 0918 400 592

Interpretation into English language: Ms Silvia Potocna


Monday, 16th April 2018

16:40 Arrival at Vienna airport from Tirana, flight OS 848 (driver waiting at the airport will hold a sign stating SlovakAid logo visibly); transport to Bratislava

18:00 Arrival in Bratislava and check in at the hotel Matyšák,
Address: Pražská 15, Bratislava

Free program


Tuesday, 17th April 2018

Breakfast at the hotel Matyšák (served from 7.00 a.m.)

08:25 Meeting with CETIR Point of Contact at hotel reception

08:30 Transfer to the SCSTI
Address: Lamačská cesta 8/A, Bratislava

09:00-09:15 Welcome by professor Ján Turňa, General Director

09:15-10:00 General overview of SCSTI activities
Mr. Ľubomír Bilský, Director of Science Support Section

10:00-10:15 Coffee break

10:15–12:00 SK ANTIPLAG, part I.
Mr. Július Kravjar, Responsible for CRTD and PDS , ISD Department

12:10 Walk to the restaurant

12:20–13:50 Working lunch at Pizzeria Romantica
Address: Gaštanová 6, Bratislava

14:00–16:00 SK ANTIPLAG, part II.
Mr. Július Kravjar

Wednesday, 18th April 2018

09:00–12:00 Series of Short Presentations (each for 20-30 minutes)

National information infrastructure for research and development (R&D)
Mr. Marián Trgala, Head of Application System Department

SK CRIS – National Current Research Information System
Ms. Danica Zendulková, Head of the CRIS Department

CREPČ – Central Registry of Publication Activity
Ms. Marta Dušková, Head of the Dept. for Evaluation of Publication Activity

10:30-10:45 Coffee break

CREUČ – Central Registry of Artistic Activity
Ms. Barbora Pokojná, Department for Evaluation of Artistic Activity
Ms. Jana Bezáková, Department for Evaluation of Artistic Activity

NITT SK – National Infrastructure for Technology Transfer
Mr. Ľubomír Bilský, Director of Science Support Section

12:10 Walk to the restaurant

12:20–13:50 Working lunch at Pizzeria Romantica
Address: Gaštanová 6, Bratislava

14:00–16:00 Questions and Answers, Discussion
Evaluation of the visit, areas of possible cooperation, potential next steps
i. Albanian view
ii. Slovak view

Thursday, 19th April 2018

12:45 Departure from Vienna airport to Tirana, flight OS 847
